datasetPresenter.name: hsapREF_massSpec_Secretome_IEC_infection_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Secretome of human intestinal epithelial cell secretome during interaction with Giardia intestinalis WB clone C6 (ATCC30957; assemblage A) and isolates GS, clone H7 (ATCC50581; assemblage B)
datasetPresenter.description: Secretome of Giardia intestinalis isolates WB clone C6 (ATCC30957; assemblage A) and GS, clone H7 (ATCC50581; assemblage B) during interaction with intestinal epithelial cells (IECs). To identify putative virulence factors and elucidate mechanistic pathways leading to disease, proteomics was used to identify the major excretory-secretory products (ESPs) when Giardia trophozoites of WB and GS isolates (assemblages A and B, respectively) interact with intestinal epithelial cells (IECs) in vitro at two time points (2hr and 6hr).

datasetPresenter.name: hsapREF_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: The genome sequence and annotation for the human genome GRCh38
datasetPresenter.description: The human genome was sequenced using a combination of Sanger, hierarchical shotgun and whole genome shotgun sequencing methods and assembled with the aide of tiled BAC clones.
datasetPresenter.history: data source changed, sequence-changed, re-annotated, mitochondrial genome and annotation added

link.text: This directory contains the Dec. 2013 assembly of Homo sapiens high coverage assembly GRCh38 from Genome Reference Consortium (GCA_000001405.22).

datasetPresenter.name: mmusC57BL6J_Saeij_Jeroen_strains_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Mouse transcriptome during infection with 29 strains of T. gondii
datasetPresenter.summary: Comparative transcriptome analysis of 29 different strains of Toxoplasma gondii and the murine macrophages infected with them (HostDB).
datasetPresenter.description: The transcriptomes of primary murine macrophages (M. musculus C57BL6J) during infection with Toxoplasma gondii (ToxoDB) were determined by Illumina RNA sequencing. Primary bone marrow-derived macrophages from C57BL/6 mice were infected with 29 different T. gondii strains. Polyadenylated RNA was isolated 20-22 hours post-infection and sequenced using the Illumina Hi-Seq 2000.

link.text: Biological Resource Centre (BRC) list of strains

datasetPresenter.name: mmusC57BL6J_macrophage_Lmexicana_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Transcriptomes of mouse macrophages infected with Leishmania mexicana
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptomes of uninfected Mus musculus bone marrow macrophages (BMDM) and 24h post-infection with Leishmania mexicana.
datasetPresenter.description:
Transcriptomes of mouse macrophages (BMDM) infected with Leishmania mexicana
Mus musculus bone marrow derived macrophage were infected with promastigotes and harvested 24h later along with uninfected control cultures. Three biological replicates were collected for each sample. Total RNA was extracted, enriched for polyA mRNA and sequenced using Illumina technology.

!!! Reads mapping to the Leishmania mexicana genome were also analyzed and are available in TriTrypDB under the data set name 'Promastigote, Axenic Amastigote and Intracellular Amastigote Transcriptomes'.

link.text: Raw RNA-seq reads mouse infected with Leishmania mexicana amastigotes
Corresponding L. mexicana data set in TriTrypDB

templateInjector.prop: Uninfected BMDMs; Leishmania mexicana Infected BMDMs

datasetPresenter.name: hsapREF_Li_Transcriptome_Remodeling_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: H sapiens Transcriptome during Infection with T cruzi
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptome of human foreskin fibroblasts during infection (time course) with T. cruzi Y strain.
datasetPresenter.description:
Transcriptomes of human foreskin fibroblasts (HFF) (ATCC #CRL-2522) infected with Trypanosoma cruzi Y strain amastigotes at 4, 6, 12, 24, 48 and 72 hrs post-infection (hpi)

Total RNA was isolated from amastigote-containing human fibroblast (ATCC #CRL-2522) monolayers at 6 time points spanning 4–72 hpi. Two to four independent biological replicates were sequenced (Illumina HiSeq1000) for each condition, generating 2.7 billion high quality reads (101 bp paired-ends) from 35 samples.

Samples:
uninf 4hpi: uninfected Hsap 4 hours post-infection
uninf 6hpi: uninfected Hsap 6 hours post-infection
uninf 12hpi: uninfected Hsap 12 hours post-infection
uninf 24hpi: uninfected Hsap 24 hours post-infection
uninf 48hpi: uninfected Hsap 48 hours post-infection
uninf 72hpi: uninfected Hsap 72 hours post-infection

amas 4hpi: Hsap 4 hours post-infection (Tcru amastigotes)
amas 6hpi: Hsap 6 hours post-infection (Tcru amastigotes)
amas 12hpi: Hsap 12 hours post-infection (Tcru amastigotes)
amas 24hpi: Hsap 24 hours post-infection (Tcru amastigotes)
amas 48hpi: Hsap 48 hours post-infection (Tcru amastigotes)
amas 72hpi: Hsap 72 hours post-infection (Tcru amastigotes)


This data set has a corresponding T. cruzi data set in TriTrypDB that is called "T cruzi Transcriptome during Infection in Human Fibroblasts."

datasetPresenter.name: mmusC57BL6J_Swierzy_Mmus_Infection_with_Tgondii_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Transcriptomes of 4 M. musculus cell types during infection with T. gondii
datasetPresenter.shortDisplayName: M mus infect w/ Tgon RNASeq
datasetPresenter.summary: M. musculus cortical neurons, astrocytes, skeletal muscle cells and fibroblast transcriptomes during infection with T. gondii strain NTE.
datasetPresenter.description: Impact of T. gondii infection on the host transcriptome using high-throughput RNA sequencing. Murine cortical neurons and astrocytes, skeletal muscle cells (SkMCs) and fibroblasts were infected with Toxoplasma gondii strain NTE and total RNA was isolated from mixed parasite/host cultures 24 hours post infection. Single end 36 bp reads (SkMCs, astrocytes, fibroblasts) or single end 50 bp reads (neurons) of the library fragments were recorded.

datasetPresenter.name: mmul17573_Galinski_Mmulatta_Infected_with_Pcynomolgi_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: M. mulatta infected with P. cynomolgi over 100 days
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptome of whole blood and bone marrow from Macaca mulatta infected with Plasmodium cynomolgi over 100 days
datasetPresenter.description:
Macaca mulatta infected with Plasmodium cynomolgi B strain to produce and integrate clinical, hematological, parasitological, and omics measures of acute primary infection and relapses.

Summary:
Five M. mulatta were inoculated with 2000 P. cynomolgi B strain sporozoites. Parasitological and haematological data were collected daily to study the clinical presentations of primary infections and relapses. Peripheral blood and bone marrow aspirates were collected at specific time points during infection for transcriptomic analysis.

Detailed Description:
Malaria-naive male rhesus macaques (Macaca mulatta), approximately three years of age, were inoculated intravenously with salivary gland sporozoites isolated at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention from multiple Anopheles species (An. dirus, An. gambiae, and An. stephensi) and then profiled for clinical, parasitological, immunological, functional genomic, lipidomic, proteomic, and metabolomic measurements. The experiment was designed for 100 days, and pre- and post-100 day periods to prepare subjects and administer curative treatments respectively. The anti-malarial drug Artemether was subcuratively administered selectively to several subjects during the primary parasitemia to suppress clinical complications and to all animals for curative treatment of blood-stage infections to allow detection of relapses. One subject was euthanized during the 100-day experimental period due to clinical complications. The anti-malarial drugs Primaquine and Chloroquine were administered to all remaining subjects at the end of the study for curative treatment of the liver and blood-stage infections, respectively. Capillary blood samples were collected daily for the measurement of CBCs, reticulocytes, and parasitemias. Capillary blood samples were collected every other day to obtain plasma for metabolomic analysis. Venous blood and bone marrow samples were collected at seven time points for functional genomic, proteomic, lipidomic, and immunological analyses. The experimental design and protocols for this study were approved by the Emory University Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).

*Transfusion information here: README


Primate ID Baseline (Pre-infection) Acute Primary Post-peak Inter-relapse Relapse
RIc14TP1TP2TP3TP5, TP7TP4, TP6
RSb14TP1TP2TP3TP5, TP7TP4, TP6
RMe14TP1TP2TP3TP4, TP5, TP7TP6
RFa14TP1TP2TP3TP4, TP5, TP6TP7
RFv13TP1TP2TP3N/AN/A
* Note that while TP4 for Rlc14 is officially classified as a relapsing time point, consumers should be aware that these samples were collected at a time when the distinction between relapse and inter-relapse was subject to clinical interpretation and may be considered as having been collected during relapse resolution.

datasetPresenter.name: hsapREF_Fernandes_LM_LA_Infection_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Leishmania major and Leishmania amazonensis RNAseq during human macrophage infection
datasetPresenter.shortDisplayName: L major and L amazonensis infection RNAseq
datasetPresenter.summary: RNAseq analysis of transcriptomes of human macrophage and parasite during an infection time course. Human macrophages were infected with Leishmania major and Leishmania amazonensis
datasetPresenter.description: RNAseq analysis of transcriptomes of human macrophage and parasite during an infection time course. Human macrophages were infected with Leishmania major and Leishmania amazonensis and RNA-seq data was mapped to both parasite and human genomes for analysis. The L. major transcriptomic data is available in TriTrypDB and the host response to infection data is available in HostDB.

link.text: Parasite transcroptomics from the same experiment

datasetPresenter.name: hsapREF_Teixeira_virulent_avirulent_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: HFF transcriptional response to virulent and avirulent T. cruzi
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptional response of human foreskin fibroblasts following infection with T. cruzi.
datasetPresenter.description: Human foreskin fibroblasts (HFF) were infected with one of two cloned strains of Trypanosoma cruzi, CL Brener and CL-14, a virulent and avirulent clone, respectively, in biological triplicate. RNA was extracted from infected HFF at 60 and 96 hours post infection and from uninfected controls using Trizol. The samples were DNAse treated and purified using a Qiagen RNeasy mini kit. Poly(A)+ RNA was selected using oligo-dT following Illumina TruSeqv2 instructions, and cDNA libraries were made using a TruSeq RNA Sample Prep Kit Version II with an average insert size of ~300 nucleotides. Libraries were sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 1500. There are 3 biological replicates for each infected condition and 4 biological replicates for the mock-infected (uninfected) condition.

datasetPresenter.name: hsapREF_massSpec_Wastling_Tgon_Ncan_infection_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Human Proteome During Infection with 4 strains of T. gondii and one strain of N. caninum
datasetPresenter.summary: H. sapiens peptide sequences from a proteomic analysis of a mixed parasite/host sample collected during T. gondii infections in human foreskin fibroblasts.
datasetPresenter.description:
Proteomic analysis of Homo Sapiens during infection with Toxoplasma gondii.

Four different strains of T. gondii tachyzoites were propagated on Vero cells before being used to infect human foreskin fibroblasts (HFFs). Confluent monolayers of HFFs were infected with approximately 10E^7 tachyzoites. Mixed host/parasite cell cultures were collected by scraping during 6 different time course infections:

HFF infected with:
1. T. gondii GT1 for 16 hrs: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 4, 8, and 16 hrs.
2. T. gondii ME49 for 16 hrs: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 4, 8, and 16 hrs.
3. T. gondii ME49 for 44 hrs: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 36, and 44 hrs.
4. T. gondii RH for 36 hrs: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 22, and 36 hrs.
5. T. gondii VEG for 16 hrs: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 4, 8, and 16 hrs.
6. T. gondii VEG for 44 hrs: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 36, and 44 hrs.

7. N. caninum LIV 36 hr time course: cultures harvested at 0, 2, and 36 hrs.

Protein preparations from infected cultures (human and parasite mixed) were trypsin digested, mixed with peptide internal standards and analysed by LC-MS/MS. Resulting spectra were searched (PEAKS Studio 7.0) against a combination of T. gondii ME49 protein sequence database (ToxoDB's "ToxoDB-8.0_TgondiiME49_AnnotatedProteins") and Human protein reference sequence database (UniProt, May 2013).
This dataset has an equivalent analysis on the parasite proteome (See ToxoDB for details).

datasetPresenter.name: hsapREF_quantitativeMassSpec_Wastling_tgon_strains_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Human Quantitative Proteome During an Infection with 4 strains of T. gondii
datasetPresenter.summary: H. sapiens peptide sequences from a proteomic analysis of mixed parasite/host samples collected during time course infections with T. gondii.
datasetPresenter.description:
Proteomic analysis of Homo Sapiens during infection with Toxoplasma gondii.

Four different strains of T. gondii tachyzoites were propagated on Vero cells before being used to infect human foreskin fibroblasts (HFFs). Confluent monolayers of HFFs were infected with approximately 10E^7 tachyzoites. Mixed host/parasite cell cultures were collected by scraping during 6 different time course infections:

HFF infected with:
1. T. gondii GT1 16 hr time course: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 4, 8, and 16 hrs.   (Blue Line)
2. T. gondii ME49 16 hr time course: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 4, 8, and 16 hrs. (Purple Line)
3. T. gondii ME49 44 hr time course: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 36, and 44 hrs.   (Green Line)
4. T. gondii RH 36 hr time course: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 22, and 36 hrs.       (Orange Line)
5. T. gondii VEG 16 hr time course: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 4, 8, and 16 hrs.  (Brunt Sienna Line)
6. T. gondii VEG 44 hr time course: cultures harvested at 0, 2, 36, and 44 hrs.    (Red Line)

Protein preparations from infected cultures (human and parasite mixed) were trypsin digested, mixed with peptide internal standards and analysed by LC-MS/MS. Resulting spectra were searched (Mascot v2.3) against a combination of T. gondii ME49 protein sequence database (ToxoDB's "ToxoDB-8.0_TgondiiME49_AnnotatedProteins") and Human protein reference sequence database (UniProt, May 2013). Quantitative analysis was carried out on Progenesis LC-MS v4.1 (Nonlinear Dynamics, UK).

This dataset has an equivalent analysis on the parasite proteome (See ToxoDB for details).

datasetPresenter.name: hsapREF_massSpec_Lasonder_Schizont_Phosphoproteome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Human Erythrocyte Phosphoproteome during infection with P. fal 3D7 schizonts (2012)
datasetPresenter.summary: Phosphoproteomic analysis of H. sapiens erythocytes harvested during the schizont stage of a P. falciparum 3D7 infection.
datasetPresenter.description:
H. sapiens phosphoproteome during infection with P. falciparum 3D7 schizonts
H. sapiens erythrocytes infected with P. falciparum 3D7 parasites were harvested when >90% of parasites were at the multinucleated schizont stage. Protein samples were prepared using two methods: Gel-electrophoresis and Gel-Free Filter Assisted Sample Preparation (FASP). Samples were analyzed by LC-MS/MS. Peptides were identified by searching the mass spectrometry data with Mascot against a combined database of P. falciparum and human proteins and were validated with the target−decoy methods of the MaxQuant software and peptides were discovered using Mascot and MaxQuant.

The corresponding P. falciparum 3D7 schizont stage phosphoproteome can be accessed on PlasmoDB.

datasetPresenter.name: btauHereford_Widmer_intracellularStages_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Host cell transcriptome in bovine cells infected with Cryptosporidium parvum
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptome of MDBK cells during C. parvum intracellular infection. Reads were mapped to the Bos taurus, breed Hereford reference genome.
datasetPresenter.description: To better understand parasite-host interactions, the transcriptome of cultured MDBK cells infected with Cryptosporidium parvum was analyzed. Four to five replicate samples of MDBK cells were sequenced 2h, 24h, and 48h post-infection. The 2-h and 24-h samples were infected with C. parvum isolate MD, whereas the 48-h samples were infected with C. parvum isolate TU114. Uninfected cells were also sequenced. C. parvum transcriptome data can be accessed through the corresponding CryptoDB dataset page.
